result.execSummary:
The defendant Marshall Rubio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs payable as follows:  $100.00 due on or before March 1, 2016 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.   Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
May serve in McColloch County, Texas.  EMP and huber allowed, according to jail rules.  Sentence to start on or before March 25, 2016 at 6:00 P.M.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by telephone.  Attorney Prior appeared in court.  Defendant wishes to proceed by telphone.  Victim notification not necessary, per ADA Inlow.   Plead no contest to Counts 1 and 2 in 15CM222.  Plead no contest to the count in 15CM229. Other counts in 15CM222 to be dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the count he is pleading to.  He understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty as plead to.  Joint recommendation for $1,640.00 restitution due with co-defendant, Bradly Drews.  90 days jail.  Concurrent.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  $1,640.00 restitution due joint and several with co-defendant, Bradly Drews.  (15CM229).  60 DTP.  90 days jail, start within 60 days, by 6:00 P.M.  May serve in McColloch County, Texas, if arrangments can be made.  Concurrent. EMP and Huber allowed according to jail rules.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement within 60 days.  Review in 60 days as to payment of restitution.  Pay CC @ $100/mo starting 3/1/16.   Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  4 days credit in 15CM222.

Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Court advised the defendant to contact SPD.  Other options explained.  AIA set for 9/28/15 at 9:30 am.  Defendant will hire his own attorney.
